message.content:
cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.DC, cs.CC, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with secure secret sharing schemes and their application to group authentication, which are topics related to cryptography and information theory. Therefore, cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) and cs.IT (Information Theory) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also discusses the efficiency and communication aspects of the proposed scheme, which suggests that it may belong to cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) or cs.CC (Computational Complexity). Finally, the paper's focus on group-oriented applications and authentication may also place it in cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
